attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There are some 65, million people in the british isles, all who have a thought on political subjects and matters, why is it that a few persons in power can determain
the lives of that 65million? Are they not elected to be the voice of the people? 
In times of major issues like war, immigration, crime and the fundamental 
things that effect each and every one of us, should be decided by the people it effects at the coalface, not by the few who live in there marble castles. 
Are politician's really afraid of referendums? would they really lose their power?

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
